> And, looking forward to seeing everyone in SF. I'll be bringing
> some interesting koshirae again and fittings as well.

So, will you actually buy a round of beer this time if a "lost" kozuka
claim proves a false alarm? HAHAHAHAHAHA!

NC ;o)

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Gordon Robson
messages.msgSnippet: I ll get a hotmail address and try that for a while. I will check at work on Tuesday and see what can be done. Now you, Ralph and Mark in Hawaii are all being
messages.messageBody:
I'll get a hotmail address and try that for a while. I will check at
work on Tuesday and see what can be done. Now you, Ralph and Mark in
Hawaii are all being blocked. Sorry for the private message on the
list. And, looking forward to seeing everyone in SF. I'll be bringing
some interesting koshirae again and fittings as well.

Gordon

On Jul 22, 2006, at 12:12 PM, Jim Gilbert wrote:

> Gordon,
> Your mail server is blocking my address now too, it's not just Ralph:
>
> SMTP error from remote mailer after RCPT TO:<robsongo@...>:
> host swumg1.swu.ac.jp [202.254.91.90]: 550 <jggilbert@...>:
> Sender address rejected: Blocked
>
> No more sword email to the work account I guess.
>
> Do you have another address? Maybe a temp account with hotmail or
> yahoo or whatever until this is sorted out.
>
> Apologies to the rest of the list, but this is in regard to the
> NTHK display at the SF show, so sword related.
>
> Thanks,
> Jim
>

>
>

messages.subject: Gordon Robson
messages.msgSnippet: Gordon, Your mail server is blocking my address now too, it s not just Ralph: SMTP error from remote mailer after RCPT TO: : host
messages.messageBody:
Gordon,
Your mail server is blocking my address now too, it's not just Ralph:

SMTP error from remote mailer after RCPT TO:<robsongo@...>:
host swumg1.swu.ac.jp [202.254.91.90]: 550 <jggilbert@...>:
Sender address rejected: Blocked

No more sword email to the work account I guess.

Do you have another address? Maybe a temp account with hotmail or yahoo or whatever until this is sorted out.

Apologies to the rest of the list, but this is in regard to the NTHK display at the SF show, so sword related.

Thanks,
Jim
